title: Politicians trying too hard in the world of sports in Best of Late Night
text:
USA TODAY

So President Trump made it to Game 5 of the World Series. And those who watched, know that he didn't get the reception he probably thought he would. He was greeted with boos and negative chants.

But did you know that Democratic presidential candidates John Delaney and Steve Bullock also reference the World Series in an attempt at political gain? How? Late-night comic Stephen Colbert explains.

Jimmy Fallon takes a look at what can go wrong with friends after an NFL game and a before and after between two football coaches.

Take a look at our favorite jokes from the weekend's late-night lineup, then vote for yours in the poll below.

Follow Eileen Rivers on Twitter @msdc14.
description: The comics talk Trump at the World Series, Democratic candidates trying to win votes at games and other sports highlights in today's webisode.
